content: in a mix of jamieson s shetland spindrift and jamieson & smith 2­ply jumper weight and shetland supreme jumper weight but you could use any shetland­style 2­ply or a pure wool wollen­spun 4­ply such as those blacker yarns make from different british sheep breeds sample colours amounts used in brackets mc spindrift madder 29g/132 3yds mc2 spindrift sunrise 2g/10 4yds cc1 spindrift yellow ochre 3g/11 5ygs cc2 j&s 2­ply118 1g/6 3yds cc3 j&s shetland supreme white 4g/15yds cc4 j&s 2­ply 202 3g/12 5yds note on choosing your own colours this is a great pattern for playing with colour and starting your adventure in designing fair isle if you need help to get started here is one way of thinking about the colours needed for this pattern using the 12­segment colour wheel pictured below cc2 the contrast colour in the central stripe green is the one directly opposite the mc red while cc1 dark yellow is equidistant between the two mc2 is the same colour as the mc but just much darker while the other two ccs white and beige are neutrals that tone with cc1 in this case warm white and warm beige to tone with yellow you could choose your own colours by picking a main colour and using the wheel to replicate the relations above for cc1 and cc2 mc2 and ccs 3 and 4 follow from those three main colours just be sure to check that they all look good together and that there s enough contrast between cc1 and the two mcs or feel free to ignore this scheme and do your own thing → an excellent resource on colour in fair isle is ann feitelson the art of fair isle knitting 1996 3
